text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text: Hey, Trainer! Hayahide! There you are!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
Hehehe! I think I even surprised myself! They said it's a new Yayoi 
Sho record!

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
When I saw Taishin right behind me, I felt this power surging up 
inside of me.

text_block_list.name: Winning Ticket
text_block_list.text:
She taught me that a rival can help you draw out a strength in yourself 
you didn't even… know you h-had… Waaaaah!

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text: I know I lost, but… I ran one heck of a race.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
I can't believe how unfair this is. I'm so envious I didn't get to race 
with you two.

If they keep this up, these three are headed straight for the first race 
of the Classics, the Satsuki Sho.

text_block_list.name: Narita Taishin
text_block_list.text:
I won't lose the next one. However good a race I give, it's 
meaningless if I don't win.

text_block_list.name: Biwa Hayahide
text_block_list.text:
Hehe, I won't be missing the Satsuki Sho either. Next time, we're in it 
together.

The first showdown is over, and—having raced her trusted 
rival—Winning Ticket smiles bigger than ever.

Now she'll push forward into the Classics and her once-in-a-lifetime 
dream, the Japanese Derby.
